pullRequest.body:
# Skew Monoid algebras
This file presents a skewed version of `Mathlib.Algebra.MonoidAlgebra.Basic`.

## Definition
We define `SkewMonoidAlgebra k G := G →₀ k` attached with a skewed convolution product.
Here, the product of two elements `f g : SkewMonoidAlgebra k G` is the finitely supported
function whose value at `a` is the sum of `f x * (x • g y)` over all pairs `x, y`
such that `x * y = a`.

This will be used in a later PR to define skew polynomial rings.

Co-authored-by: María Inés de Frutos Fernández <[mariaines.dff@gmail.com](mailto:mariaines.dff@gmail.com)>

---

nodes.body: I got pinged because there was a botched-up history for this PR. I force-pushed so that the diff looks much more reasonable now.

Hi Floris, 

Thank you that's indeed what I was trying to do. 
Sorry about this!
Xavier

Hello everyone,

This PR has been updated to match the planned refactor from @adomani to MonoidAlgebra.

This means that we now use the following definition:
```
structure SkewMonoidAlgebra (k : Type*) (G : Type*) [Zero k] where ofFinsupp ::
  /-- Map to the associated finitely supported function `G →₀ k`. -/
  toFinsupp : G →₀ k
```
To support this separation from `Finsupp`, we have adapted many `Finsupp` lemmas to deal directly with `SkewMonoidAlgebra`. This was inspired by how the `Polynomial` file currently deals with a similar separation. These are the main addition to this update.

General comments:

* The main file is extremly well written, maybe thanks to the initial file on MonoidAlgebra, but still.

* It is very long, I wonder whether it could be split in a relevant way

* An important part of the file consists in transferring lemmas from Finsupp to this new type that encapsulates Finsupp into a field. While this is inevitable for the moment, I don't believe that such lines have to be written by hand. Is there a possibility to define a new type in this way and automagically transfer some lemmas to the new type? (Maybe that boring part could be in `Init`.)

### PR summary [f7be1b5b1e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541/commits/f7be1b5b1e0a05b74e5c9b2e65c97653a8dfe266)

I will leave the [question](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/.2310541.3A.20SkewMonoidAlgebra/near/452575660) on whether we should keep the `coeFun` instance open until Monday. I'll then do the winning change.

Thank you for the feedback @AntoineChambert-Loir!
Before I get to it, let me push the commit that fixes this [issue](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/.2310541.3A.20SkewMonoidAlgebra/near/452575660).

Here are the notable changes:
- We now have a `coeff` function.
- `SkewMonoidAlgebra.sum` now uses this function, just like in polynomial.
- I have repurposed the `@[ext]` to the following lemma:
```
@[ext]
theorem ext {p q : SkewMonoidAlgebra k G} : (∀ a, coeff p a = coeff q a) → p = q :=
  ...
```
Instead of 
```
theorem ext {f g : SkewMonoidAlgebra k G} : f.toFinsupp = g.toFinsupp → f = g :=
  ...
```
I chose to do this since we want to "forget" about `Finsupp` and I thought it made more sense to have the `ext` tactic like in `Polynomial`. That being said, for the current file the old `ext` was pretty useful and its use has been replaced with `toFinsupp_inj` and `toFinsupp_injective`.

There are many open conversations above that I am not sure how to resolve. The issues raised mostly stem from the fact that the separation is based on the one done in `Polynomial`, which duplicates theorems from `Finsupp`. Branching out from this would mean that we would no longer have the same theorems as in `Finsupp` which is a little bit unintuitive. With all of this in mind, I am no Mathlib expert and I am happy to be pointed to the correct direction (Leave things as they are or diverge). Here is a summary of the remaining issues:
- The file is [too long](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10075130070/job/27852708877) : I could split the file into two or more files by collecting the relevant sections together; but I am not an expert in this matter.
- `IsSMulRegular` ([1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1646695226), [2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1689495429)): This follows what has been done in `Finsupp`and `Polynomial`. I am happy to add the more general theorems suggested if we are ok with divergence.
- [`Module.Free`](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1689491543) : This can be added and should take around 10-15 lines but we might want to split the file first.
- `mul_apply_antidiagonal` : I have suggested a [fix](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1679480901).
- `smul` is not irreducible ([1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1680458770), [2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1684695183)) : As discussed this was to follow the style from `Polynomial`, I am happy to change it if we want to diverge from `Polynomial`.
- Automation ([1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#issuecomment-2179484812), [2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1689479889), [3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1689496129)): I think these are out of scope for this PR but indeed should be noted somewhere if such separation are to happen often.
- Unresolved conversations ([1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1680463959), [2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1689512167), [3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1689516061)): For the rest of the unresolved conversation, I have left them open in case my answer is not satisfactory. Do let me know.

My understanding of these matter is

- I am not sure that `Polynomial` is mathlib's final word on the subject, and this work on `SkewMonoidAlgebra` might be, on the contrary, the occasion to lay down the API that fills the needs. And then `Polynomial` and `MvPolynomial` and `MonoidAlgebra` would align on it.  (This alignment should be partly automatized, I believe.)

- I understand that it might be better to split the file first, but (as far as I understand) nonreducible definitions will make it impossible to have results in another file.

I see, thank you for you answer.

For the first point, should I ask on Zulip? (As this issue seem to touch more than `SkewMonoidAlgebra`)

As for the second point, I think you are right for the private definitions at the beginning but for later sections, I seem to be able to split them. (For example, `coeff_mul`, `equivMapDomain` and `domCongr` can be put in another file without trouble.)
I hope that asking on Zulip would give you answers.

On the second point:

Actually, the fact that I can put `equivMapDomain` in another file might be a problem. As `toFinsupp_injective` is not private at the moment, we can still use `Finsupp` lemmas in another file to prove things about `SkewMonoidAlgebra`. Is the goal to prevent this or would that be allowed?

Hello everyone, 

Following [this](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/.60SkewMonoidAlgebra.60.20and.20the.20separation.20with.20.60Finsupp.60/near/456861000) comment, I have opened #15878.

Thanks for your help!
Xavier

```suggestion import Mathlib.Algebra.SkewMonoidAlgebra.Basic import Mathlib.Algebra.Squarefree.Basic ```
Is it a mathematical prerequisite or is some instance similar as `MulSemiringAction G k` missing?

The proof that we have for associativity of the skew monoid algebra (starting in line 192) uses most of the properties of `MulSemiringAction`, except for `smul_one`. It would be possible to create a class analogous to `MulSemiringAction` that does not require `G` to be a monoid (instead requiring only `Mul G`), and our proof should work for that class, but I don't know if this is worth it (do you know of any interesting examples where G is only a magma?).
Other than that, I don't know a proof that holds in greater generality, but if you do, we would be happy to use it.

Suggestion : while `AddCommMonoid k`, keep it such.
Reason: you could later have an action of a skew algebra on a skew module…
See new commit where some of the hypotheses have been changed.

Note that @adomani is planning a refactor to `MonoidAlgebra` to make the definition
```suggestion
structure SkewMonoidAlgebra : Type max u₁ u₂ where ofFinsupp ::
  toFinsupp : G →₀ k
```
It might be worth getting this new version "right" the first time rather than increasing the number of things @adomani will want to change!
Thanks Eric, we are aware of that and Xavier is working on changing our definition.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (SkewMonoidAlgebra A G) ≃ₗ[k] SkewMonoidAlgebra A H := ```

This is already the default in mathlib
```suggestion
```
This lemma could be deduced from the fact that the skewMonoidAlgebra is a free k-module. Is it worth doing it here?

I don't have a strong opinion on the lemma's position; it follows the structure used in the Polynomial file.

We don't currently have the fact that a SkewMonoidAlgebra is a free k-module, but I can add it if you think it's relevant.
As for the fact that the lemma entails from the free module structure, we chose this proof because it matches the idea from `finsupp` and `polynomial`. I think it's more natural to use the `Finsupp` structure than to do a small detour with the k-module structure. What do you think?
The freeness of the `SkewMonoidAlgebra` is important to add here, because it follows from the construction, but not from the universal property.

Would you be ok with me adding the freeness independently of this? Meaning I would leave `IsSMulRegular.skewMonoidAlgebra` as is.

An other problem is that the file is getting really long.

The freeness is proved below, as a direct application of [Module.Free.of_equiv](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/FreeModule/Basic.html#Module.Free.of_equiv).
Two lemmas are apparently missing, 1/ that freeness implies the IsSMulRegular condition, 2/ that this condition is preserved under a LinearEquiv.
I don't want to insist that you add this here, but can you please add this on a list of TODO. Otherwise, I fear that this will be forgotten and rediscovered 10 times.
Will do

I am puzzled by the applicability of this lemma. It requires the monoid to be very particular (G = Z doesn't work), but the statement holds for `s : Set (G × G)` using the fact that `f` and `g`have finite support.

This is a good point.

I can prove the following:
```
theorem mul_apply_antidiagonal' [Monoid G] (f g : SkewMonoidAlgebra k G) [MulSemiringAction G k]
    (x : G) (s : Finset (G × G)) (hs : ∀ {p : G × G}, p ∈ s ↔
    (p.1 ∈ f.support ∧ p.2 ∈ g.support ∧ p.1 * p.2 = x)) :
    (f * g) x = ∑ p in s, f p.1 * p.1 • g p.2
```
I think this fixes the issue you raised and should work when we consider the additive monoid `Z`. I still think this kind of statement is a bit weird, there might be a better way to phrase this type of theorem.
Assuming the correction I proposed fixes your issue, do you think we should keep both versions? Or just the new one?
what does this comment mean?
delete comment
delete blank line

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion theorem single_add (a : G) (b₁ b₂ : k) : single a (b₁ + b₂) = single a b₁ + single a b₂ := by ext; simp only [Finsupp.single_add, Finsupp.coe_add, Pi.add_apply, toFinsupp_add] ```

```suggestion
structure SkewMonoidAlgebra (k : Type*) (G : Type*) [Zero k] where
  /-- Map from the associated finitely supported function. -/
  ofFinsupp ::
```
or something like that

```suggestion
    SkewMonoidAlgebra k G → SkewMonoidAlgebra k G → SkewMonoidAlgebra k G
```
Why is `add` irreducible but not `smul`?
This was to remain consistent with `Polynomial`. Do you think we should change this?
That's... weird for sure
I believe it is good practice to have the inner construction inaccessible to the users other than through the designed API.
I am in favour of making `smul` irreducible.

```suggestion
  ofFinsupp_injective.eq_iff
```
I think is better in terms of expectability
Is this not a bit dangerous as an instance? Are we not trying to avoid people thinking of `MonoidAlgebra` as being made of functions?
That's a good point, I asked for opinions on Zulip [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/.2310541.3A.20SkewMonoidAlgebra/near/452575660).

My impression is that a lot of work in the file consists in transferring by hand results from `Finsupp.` to `SkewMonoidAlgebra.`, in a way that lets users manipulate them from both sides at the same time. 
And maybe this should be specifically prevented.
This has been changed.
What's the point of this lemma? It's a straightforward consequence of others

This was added to match `Finsupp.card_support_eq_zero` and `Polynomial.card_support_eq_zero`. It is true that the use cases seem to be limited, see [Mathlib/Algebra/Polynomial/EraseLead](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/29d0c941b8a42432a63634d6d82ce60faabfe817/Mathlib/Algebra/Polynomial/EraseLead.lean#L90) and [Mathlib/GroupTheory/Perm/Support](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/29d0c941b8a42432a63634d6d82ce60faabfe817/Mathlib/GroupTheory/Perm/Support.lean#L571). We can remove it if you deem it superfluous.
Yeah, it looks pretty useless
I removed it.

```suggestion
theorem mem_support_iff {f : SkewMonoidAlgebra k G} {a : G} : a ∈ f.support ↔ f a ≠ 0 := by
```
Why is this an `abbrev`?
I updated this to a def.

```suggestion
def toFinsuppAddEquiv : SkewMonoidAlgebra k G ≃+ (G →₀ k) where
```

```suggestion
  f.toFinsupp.sum g
```
Is there much point to this definition? I would think you don't usually see sums indexed by an element of a skew monoid algebra in paper maths

This definition is similar to `Finsupp.sum` (as you can see in the def) and indexes the sum on the support of `f`. In my opinion this is very useful and we will need this.

That being said, this definition might change depending on whether or not we do a `coeff` function (see [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/.2310541.3A.20SkewMonoidAlgebra/near/452575660)). Because of this, I will leave this unresolved for now.
This has changed, the definition is now very close to the one found in `Polynomial`.

```suggestion
theorem natCast_def (n : ℕ) : (n : SkewMonoidAlgebra k G) = single (1 : G) (n : k) := rfl
```
to follow the naming convention

```suggestion
    [IsCentralScalar S k] : IsCentralScalar S (SkewMonoidAlgebra k G) where
  op_smul_eq_smul := by rintro _ ⟨⟩; simp_rw [← ofFinsupp_smul, op_smul_eq_smul]⟩
```
is a bit nicer maybe

```suggestion
```

```suggestion

section NonUnitalNonAssocAlgebra
```
Is the suggested change to delete the comment? We took it from the structure of MonoidAlgebra.
No, sorry if the diff is unclear. It's adding a blank line between the comment and the section

```suggestion
```

Well it's not a map to/from "the associated finitely supported function", but the type thereof. Maybe either
```suggestion
  /-- Map **from** `G →₀ k`. -/
  ofFinsupp ::
  /-- Map **to** `G →₀ k`. -/
```
or
```suggestion
  /-- Construct an element of the skew monoid algebra from its associated finitely supported function. -/
  ofFinsupp ::
  /-- The finitely supported function associated to an element of the skew monoid algebra. -/
```

This is now a no op
```suggestion
```

```suggestion
/-- A more convenient spelling of `SkewMonoidAlgebra.ofFinsupp.injEq` in terms of `Iff`. -/
theorem ofFinsupp_inj {a b} : (⟨a⟩ : SkewMonoidAlgebra k G) = ⟨b⟩ ↔ a = b :=
  ofFinsupp_injective.eq_iff
  
@[simp]
theorem toFinsupp_eq_zero {a : SkewMonoidAlgebra k G} : a.toFinsupp = 0 ↔ a = 0 := by
  rw [← toFinsupp_zero, toFinsupp_inj]
```
seems more logical

```suggestion
  __ := toFinsupp_injective.addCommMonoid _ toFinsupp_zero toFinsupp_add toFinsupp_smul
  toAdd  := SkewMonoidAlgebra.add'
  toZero := SkewMonoidAlgebra.zero
  nsmul  := (. • .)
```
Similarly, are you sure you want this to be an abbrev?

```suggestion
    NonUnitalNonAssocSemiring (SkewMonoidAlgebra k G) where
  left_distrib f g h := by
    haveI := Classical.decEq G
    simp only [mul_def]
    refine Eq.trans (congr_arg (sum f) (funext₂ fun a₁ b₁ => sum_add_index ?_ ?_)) ?_ <;>
      simp only [smul_zero, smul_add, mul_add, mul_zero, single_zero, single_add,
        forall_true_iff, sum_add]
  right_distrib f g h := by
    haveI := Classical.decEq G
    simp only [mul_def]
    refine Eq.trans (sum_add_index ?_ ?_) ?_ <;>
      simp only [add_mul, zero_mul, single_zero, single_add, forall_true_iff, sum_zero, sum_add]
  zero_mul f := by
    simp only [mul_def]
    exact sum_zero_index
  mul_zero f := by
    simp only [mul_def]
    exact Eq.trans (congr_arg (sum f) (funext₂ fun a₁ b₁ => sum_zero_index)) sum_zero
```
etc

```suggestion
theorem intCast_def [Ring k] [Monoid G] [MulSemiringAction G k] (z : ℤ) :
```
Could this be added for `IsCancelLeftMul` and `IsCancelRightMul`too?
Sure! Here you go.
This is probably not a task for this PR, but given the definition of the structure `SkewMonoidAlgebra`, shouldn't this lemma be generated automatically, à la `@[simps]`?
This could be an `iff`, but I don't know whether it's important to state formally (the converse holds in large generality…)

Should I do another theorem since the `iff` requires `Nonempty G`? (though I don't think we really care about the [Empty G] case.)

Another thing is that I feel it would be weird to have this kind of theorem here when it is not in `Finsupp`.
As I said above, the lemma should be about free (nonzero — you're right) modules. I'll be happy if it's in the TODO list.
in a nice world, all of this should be generated automatically.
Is it worth adding that `toFinsuppAddEquiv (single a b) = single a b`?
This already exists thanks to the `@[apply]` tag. (composed with `toFinsupp_single`)
why the ' in the name?
This comes from `Finsupp` and `Polynomial`. It is thought to be useful to have the two forms of the lemma. So we have `sum_smul_index` and `sum_smul_index'`
def toFinsuppLinearEquiv [AddCommMonoid k] [Module S k] :
Could these be unified?

```suggestion
theorem eta (f : SkewMonoidAlgebra k G) : ofFinsupp f.toFinsupp = f := rfl
```
`smul` can't be irreducible, as this creates diamonds. I think there is a comment about this for `Polynomial`.
@YaelDillies Is it OK with you if I revert the change?

Do we want to hide these from the kernel and frontend or just the frontend? I generally prefer `irreducible` over `irreducible_def` unless we really see an effect on the kernel. 

I worry that the diamonds are just a indication of poor API boundaries for current implementation of `Polynomial`

I think the test I'm thinking of is this one:

https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/b1409cd63e3857e58c473d1d9cc2433b3bb56c5c/test/instance_diamonds.lean#L98-L100
I am still hopeful that can be addressed with better boundaries to avoid exposing `Finsupp`.
The problem is that making `smul` irreducible makes it impossible for `smul a p` and `smul (f a) p` for `f : A -> R` to be defeq, even if the former contains `f` internally.

pullRequest.title: feat(Algebra/SkewMonoidAlgebra/Basic): add SkewMonoidAlgebra

nodes.body: some comments, but I'll read later.
I got pinged because there was a botched-up history for this PR. I force-pushed so that the diff looks much more reasonable now.

Hi Floris, 

Thank you that's indeed what I was trying to do. 
Sorry about this!
Xavier

Hello everyone,

This PR has been updated to match the planned refactor from @adomani to MonoidAlgebra.

This means that we now use the following definition:
```
structure SkewMonoidAlgebra (k : Type*) (G : Type*) [Zero k] where ofFinsupp ::
  /-- Map to the associated finitely supported function `G →₀ k`. -/
  toFinsupp : G →₀ k
```
To support this separation from `Finsupp`, we have adapted many `Finsupp` lemmas to deal directly with `SkewMonoidAlgebra`. This was inspired by how the `Polynomial` file currently deals with a similar separation. These are the main addition to this update.

General comments:

* The main file is extremly well written, maybe thanks to the initial file on MonoidAlgebra, but still.

* It is very long, I wonder whether it could be split in a relevant way

* An important part of the file consists in transferring lemmas from Finsupp to this new type that encapsulates Finsupp into a field. While this is inevitable for the moment, I don't believe that such lines have to be written by hand. Is there a possibility to define a new type in this way and automagically transfer some lemmas to the new type? (Maybe that boring part could be in `Init`.)

### PR summary [f7be1b5b1e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541/commits/f7be1b5b1e0a05b74e5c9b2e65c97653a8dfe266)

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

I will leave the [question](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/.2310541.3A.20SkewMonoidAlgebra/near/452575660) on whether we should keep the `coeFun` instance open until Monday. I'll then do the winning change.

Thank you for the feedback @AntoineChambert-Loir!
Before I get to it, let me push the commit that fixes this [issue](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/.2310541.3A.20SkewMonoidAlgebra/near/452575660).

Here are the notable changes:
- We now have a `coeff` function.
- `SkewMonoidAlgebra.sum` now uses this function, just like in polynomial.
- I have repurposed the `@[ext]` to the following lemma:
```
@[ext]
theorem ext {p q : SkewMonoidAlgebra k G} : (∀ a, coeff p a = coeff q a) → p = q :=
  ...
```
Instead of 
```
theorem ext {f g : SkewMonoidAlgebra k G} : f.toFinsupp = g.toFinsupp → f = g :=
  ...
```
I chose to do this since we want to "forget" about `Finsupp` and I thought it made more sense to have the `ext` tactic like in `Polynomial`. That being said, for the current file the old `ext` was pretty useful and its use has been replaced with `toFinsupp_inj` and `toFinsupp_injective`.

There are many open conversations above that I am not sure how to resolve. The issues raised mostly stem from the fact that the separation is based on the one done in `Polynomial`, which duplicates theorems from `Finsupp`. Branching out from this would mean that we would no longer have the same theorems as in `Finsupp` which is a little bit unintuitive. With all of this in mind, I am no Mathlib expert and I am happy to be pointed to the correct direction (Leave things as they are or diverge). Here is a summary of the remaining issues:
- The file is [too long](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10075130070/job/27852708877) : I could split the file into two or more files by collecting the relevant sections together; but I am not an expert in this matter.
- `IsSMulRegular` ([1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1646695226), [2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1689495429)): This follows what has been done in `Finsupp`and `Polynomial`. I am happy to add the more general theorems suggested if we are ok with divergence.
- [`Module.Free`](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1689491543) : This can be added and should take around 10-15 lines but we might want to split the file first.
- `mul_apply_antidiagonal` : I have suggested a [fix](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1679480901).
- `smul` is not irreducible ([1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1680458770), [2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1684695183)) : As discussed this was to follow the style from `Polynomial`, I am happy to change it if we want to diverge from `Polynomial`.
- Automation ([1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#issuecomment-2179484812), [2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1689479889), [3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1689496129)): I think these are out of scope for this PR but indeed should be noted somewhere if such separation are to happen often.
- Unresolved conversations ([1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1680463959), [2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1689512167), [3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1689516061)): For the rest of the unresolved conversation, I have left them open in case my answer is not satisfactory. Do let me know.

My understanding of these matter is

- I am not sure that `Polynomial` is mathlib's final word on the subject, and this work on `SkewMonoidAlgebra` might be, on the contrary, the occasion to lay down the API that fills the needs. And then `Polynomial` and `MvPolynomial` and `MonoidAlgebra` would align on it.  (This alignment should be partly automatized, I believe.)

- I understand that it might be better to split the file first, but (as far as I understand) nonreducible definitions will make it impossible to have results in another file.

I see, thank you for you answer.

For the first point, should I ask on Zulip? (As this issue seem to touch more than `SkewMonoidAlgebra`)

As for the second point, I think you are right for the private definitions at the beginning but for later sections, I seem to be able to split them. (For example, `coeff_mul`, `equivMapDomain` and `domCongr` can be put in another file without trouble.)
I hope that asking on Zulip would give you answers.

On the second point:

Actually, the fact that I can put `equivMapDomain` in another file might be a problem. As `toFinsupp_injective` is not private at the moment, we can still use `Finsupp` lemmas in another file to prove things about `SkewMonoidAlgebra`. Is the goal to prevent this or would that be allowed?

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(SkewMonoidAlgebra): add SkewMonoidAlgebra with irreducible def

nodes.body:
Hello everyone, 

Following [this](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/.60SkewMonoidAlgebra.60.20and.20the.20separation.20with.20.60Finsupp.60/near/456861000) comment, I have opened #15878.

Thanks for your help!
Xavier

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#15878~~
* leanprover-community/mathlib4#19084
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
